upgrade.title: SUSE® OpenStack Cloud Crowbar: Upgrade from SUSE OpenStack Cloud 5

introduction.title: Upgrade to SUSE OpenStack Cloud 6
introduction.description: Upgrading is a multistep process. The first few steps of this process are still done using the SUSE OpenStack Cloud 5 version of the Administration Server. After that you will be asked to reinstall the Server with SUSE OpenStack Cloud 6, where the rest of the upgrade Process is performed. At some point during the upgrade the OpenStack Cloud will be turned off and all cloud services will be inaccessible. It is highly recommended to back up data before the upgrade.

nodes.title: Prepare Nodes for Upgrade
nodes.description: As a first step all client nodes of this setup need to be prepared to allow the administration server to be upgraded. Click 'Prepare Nodes for Upgrade' to start that preparation. It is still possible to revert the Upgrade Process after that.

backup.name: Download Upgrade Data
backup.title: Download the Upgrade Data
backup.description: This step will create a tar archive with all relevant data to restore your setup later on the SUSE OpenStack Cloud 6 Administration Server. Click 'Download Upgrade Data' and keep that tar archive in a secure place. You will be asked to upload it later on in the process. After you downloaded and saved the upgrade data click 'Continue Upgrade Process'.

reinstall-admin.name: Reinstall Admin Server
reinstall-admin.title: Reinstall SUSE OpenStack Cloud 6
reinstall-admin.description: As the next step in the upgrade process you need to redeploy the Administration Server with the new version of SUSE OpenStack Cloud. Please make sure to redeploy on the very same machine using the same network configuration as before. Note, after redeploying it is not possible anymore to get back to SUSE OpenStack Cloud 5.
reinstall-admin.description2: Please reassure that you successfully downloaded the upgrade data and continue the upgrade process by redeploying the Administration Server. After that, open the Web Interface again and select the 'Continue Upgrade Process' option in the installation wizard.

continue-upgrade.name: Continue Upgrade
continue-upgrade.title: Continue Upgrade
continue-upgrade.description: Select the upgrade data archive that you downloaded from the SUSE OpenStack Cloud 5 Administration server when you started the upgrade wizard. Upload it by clicking 'Upload and Restore'.

restore-admin.name: Restore
restore-admin.title: Restore
restore-admin.description: The upgrade-data was uploaded successfully. The restoration process may take a long time to import the required data from the SUSE OpenStack Cloud 5 Administration Server while the installation process runs in the background.
restore-admin.description2: The crowbar admin password will be required, possibly more than once. The password is either the default password or, depending on whether the password was changed in SUSE OpenStack Cloud 5, the one set by the user.

verify-repos.name: Verify Repositories
verify-repos.title: Verify Add-On Product Repositories
verify-repos.description: This step verifies that the software repositories for "SUSE Linux Enterprise High Availability Extension" and "SUSE Enterprise Storage" are available if they were previously installed on SUSE OpenStack Cloud 5.

stop-openstack-services.name: Stop OpenStack Services
stop-openstack-services.title: Stop OpenStack Services
stop-openstack-services.description: Continuing the upgrade process by clicking 'Stop OpenStack Services' below will stop all services on the client nodes. This is the last chance to access any OpenStack service. If you haven't done so yet, please shut down all VM instances in your cloud and backup everything needed which uses OpenStack APIs.

openstack-backup.name: Data Backup
openstack-backup.title: Database Dump
openstack-backup.description: The SQL dump of the database was created. This will be re-imported later when re-applying the OpenStack barclamps. It is strongly recommended to download this dump.

backup.node: Download the database dump from node {{name}}.
backup.path: The file can be found here: {{path}}.

upgrade-nodes-os.name: Upgrading Nodes OS
upgrade-nodes-os.title: Upgrading Nodes OS
upgrade-nodes-os.description: All services on the client nodes have now been stopped. Next, the client nodes will be upgraded to SLES 12 SP1. To begin this process click 'Upgrade Nodes Now'. This process will take a long time, so please be patient.

finishing-upgrade.name: Finishing Upgrade
finishing-upgrade.title: Finishing Upgrade
finishing-upgrade.description: Please wait until all nodes are upgraded. This may take a long time.
